text: Great ambiance with good food. The staff was attentive and professional. The accommodated a group of 14 with ease and a peanut allergy. We almost double tipped them but the staff was so professional , they pointed out our error and enabled us to reimburse the family member who covered the bill. We would recommend this place to anyone.

I've been here 6 times now. Come whenever I'm in Vegas. Food is excellent. The belly dancers are fun and music thumping. The steak skewers are tremendous - perfectly seasoned. I'm a life-long customer.

I came here yesterday with a guest, and while the service was great, the food wasn't as awesome as I would have hoped. The portion sizes were great. I just felt that the main dish (chicken and couscous) were not as flavorful as I would have hoped. 

Also, the dancers were only out about half of the time we were there. It would have been nice if there was entertainment the whole time.

The only reason I didnt give this restaurant a 5 star rating is because of the service.
Servers were not very friendly and were slightly rude. We actually noticed them looking at the customers and sort of making fun of people. That  was a big turn off for all of us. It seemed as they didnt want to spend too much time with customers, they were more interested in watching the belly dance performance :-)

The atmosphere and music are great, belly dancers are beautiful and very good performers. 
They serve a 6 course meal, which I really enjoyed. My favorite was definitely desert: chocolate, cinnamon and pastry.. it was heavenly.

Overall tasty food and fun atmosphere, but servers ruined what couldve been a great experience.

Don't the let strip mall exterior fool you! Also the single room when you walk in was fully decorated in authentic lighting and fabrics (tented). We were a group of 11- a bachelorette group and we were ready for an experience!

The staff was very attentive and the belly dancers were talented. Each performance they roamed the room, pulling up diners from each table to dance. Perfect for celebrating a birthday or special occasion. 

The food however delicious was A LOT!!!! At the third course we were done for. The last course, dessert...... WORTH THE WAIT!

Service d zebbi! If you are Moroccan, don't go there, because they'll treat you like crap. I had the feeling they don't like Moroccans because they would criticize the non sense they serving, but at least for the price people deserve a decent service and no attitude form the servers. If you are not Moroccan, maybe you don't know any better, because it's far from Moroccan authenticity. I wish vegas has a better a Moroccan place to try.

I absolutely LOVED this place! However be ready to eat! U get a pre course meal and it's absolutely amazing... starting with shrimp scampi, then soup, then dips, then kabobs, then chicken and cous coups and when u thought u we're done they bring out a delicious mini cake with hot tea. Needless to say this place will leave u full and full of authentic Moroccan spirit. If ur ever in Vegas and don't wanna go to the usual overrated spots, come here! U won't regret it!

We enjoyed our meal and the atmosphere.   The menu was preset and the food was very flavorful and very home made tasting.   The belly dancer was very good and the service was excellent.   I think with the preset menu you may lose some of the ethnicity of the food as it must appeal to everyone.   Overall very good.

My husband and I enjoyed our dining experience here. The belly dancers were very good.  Overall the food was pretty good. The shrimp was overcooked but the kabob's were excellent.  We liked the moroccan wine also.  We came for the overall experience and did not have super high expectations on the food anyway.

Don't be fooled by the exterior... Once you get inside you'll feel like you're in Morocco! Service was a little slow at the beginning but once your 6 course meal starts it moves swiftly along! Great food and good atmosphere! We will be back!

Fantastic food and cultural experience. Fixed menu limits the frequency of visits, but definitely a place to take out-of-town guests to show them something a little different. I would fully recommend this place to anyone!
A little out of my price range but between the belly dancer and great food it's well worth my money ! Very calm relaxing vibe with a authentic twist you can't find in Vegas any more !

When we drove up were weren't quite sure what to expect as the restaurant is situated in a small unassuming strip mall.  Once we walked inside any hesitations we had were whisked away.  The decor is great, the food absolutely delicious and the dancing very entertaining.  The best evening meal we had while in Vegas!  

If you looking for something unique and away from the casinos this is the place!

Oh boy... what can I say? It's simple, words cannot describe how delicious the food from this place is. It is one of the two places I have ever gone to that from start (appetizers) to finish (dessert) everything was great. I loved the atmosphere, made you feel like you were in a whole other world. The customer service was excellent. I thought it was a nice touch when they come to your table with rose water and you clean your hands before you eat. 

What was the menu? 
Lentil Soup 
bread 
hummus/veggie platter 
beef kabob 
chicken with Moroccan spices 
and a banana dessert

Not for me.  I was here for a large birthday party and did not enjoy the food.  The atmosphere is fun as it is unusual and the belly dancers create a unique experience.  Have not been back to dine again.

It doesn't look like this place is anything special from the outside, linked in with random stores in a tiny strip mall, but it will surprise you from the second you walk in. 

The decor is authentic and unique. You seem transported to what feels like a cool, Moroccan palace. Since the menu is already planned in courses (prix fixe)- sit back and enjoy the experience. 

It begins with hand washing in what smells of soft, fragrant roses and ends with a dessert that is everything your sweet and savory tooth desires. The courses of food are so good and the cocktails are too! A warm mint tea soothes after the large meal. Having a prix fixe menu allows the diner to really relax and allow the restaurant to take them on a tasteful journey. 

This place is a Las Vegas experience and guests always love it when we take them here. But it's also fun for locals too. Be ready to dine for a few hours  and come with an empty stomach!

This is an amazing restaurant. From the ambiance to the service, from the food to dancing - it truly has it all. I recommend both locals and tourist make this a "must-see." You wont be disappointed. 
After washing your hands in warm rose water, prepare to dive into a five course meal that will tantalize your senses. And if you have a chance in between bites, make sure you take notice of the beautiful belly dancers that perform throughout the night. You may even find yourself performing right along with them! 
Its truly a great time for the whole family. I am SO glad I found this place.

This place is amazing! I ordered the hummus and a falafel side through uber eats. It was THE BEST FALAFEL I HAVE EVER HAD! super light, crispy, and served with a hearty side of perfect hummus and semi-pickled veggies. My order came with a whole loaf of traditional  challah bread, PERFECT pita chips, and fresh-baked pita bread. I am very impressed with the taste, presentation, price/value and prompt preparation. I will definitely go back.

Never had Moroccan food before. Walking in I was scared...I'm not an adventurous foodie nor am I keen on trying new cuisine. I'm definitely a creature of habit. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!  

Menu is quite simple: 6  course price fixe menu. Shrimp scampi appetizer, "cinnamon - tomato soup" (my description, I don't know if it was actual tomato soup), hummus, beef skewers, chicken & couscous, and a chocolate banana pastry with powdered sugar (that can be made with peaches or pear) served with a hot tea.  

I loved that the only utensil available...were your fingers (until the chicken dish & desert).

The flavors were wonderful. Not too little, not too much. Just right. The soup had a cinnamon taste to it which I found delightful & surprising. The skewers presentation was fun: delivered a la pineapple. I really enjoyed these two courses and filled up on these and the shrimp scampi. I really needed to be rolled out of the restaurant...I ate way to much. Unfortunately, I did not care for the hummus. (Did I spell that correctly?)

The place is small & dark inside. Seating very comfortable; it was dining on the sofa in your living room. 1 belly dancer performed at a time.  I loved the entire experience. Already looking for an excuse to go back!!

Absolutely the best food ever. All of it was fabulous! The dessert was out of this world! Great belly dancers. Very talented. Next time in Vegas, we are going back for sure! I highly recommend this place!

The food is amazing, the entertainment is great, & the staff is so accommodating and nice!  The owner Tariq always makes me and my guests feel welcome whenever we come here.  This will be my second birthday that I'm celebrating here, and all I can say is - if you want to have an amazing time, come to Marrakech! You will NOT be disappointed.

Marrakech was an oasis of wonderful food and atmosphere on our recent trip to Vegas.  The decor is stunning and the shaabi/rai music was manna to my abused ears (seriously, did they stop importing music into Vegas in the early 90s?  so much bad music everywhere we went!).  The food was by far the best we had during our trip; you can tell the difference between chefs who make food because they care about food and chefs who design dishes to please the masses, and the chefs at Marrakech are definitely the former.  We were stuffed by the kabobs, but made a valiant effort to eat what we could of the couscous and the sweet bistilla served for dessert.

And of course there was the belly dancing--house dancer Aradia put on an excellent show, full of energy even though the restaurant was not that busy on a Tuesday evening.  I'm a dancer myself and I can say with authority that she is very good, a national class dancer and a great entertainer.

In short, Marrakech is the real deal and I highly recommend it!

Went to Marrakech this evening with some friends.  Arrived on the early side, around 6:30p.   Ambiance was fun--1001 Arabian nights stuff.  Food was middle of the road--not bad--just not particularly unique or flavorful.  Service was very attentive/good.  The belly dancer provided some decent  entertainment, although it was a little weird watching a 5 year old boy tucking dollar bills in belly dancer's skirt at his parents' insistence.  Actually, perhaps it was a sort of training ritual               to prepare hims for his future trips to Vegas.

Wow!!  Love how there are No menu ..set course Meal...Food Is Great .. Belly Dancers for entertainment. Great for First Date...:) 

Love the ambiance, BUT
Many Many years ago, they had Pillows all Around to sit on or lay back and was very Cozy & Very relax,   but now they have mini chair ; dont like  ..:( 

Over all Great Place!!

We have gone to this restaurant on two of our Vegas trips.  It is a very short drive from the strip and well worth it.  The Moroccan experience at Marrakech is just as good as the food.  The belly dancer was awesome.  She encouraged my wife to get up and shake her booty.

The food is awesome as well.  I like not having to worrying about ordering they just keep bringing the food.  The service is top notch, glass of water always full, never have to ask for more bread and the next course comes just as you wash down the prior course with your beverage.

The place isn't cheap and I got the impression that the menu doesn't change much so I'm not sure if this is a good place to go to more than once a month.  The groups we saw there were having an AWESOME time.  Lots of locals here, this is a good place to go if you want to get off the strip.

There isn't any good Moroccan in San Diego so when SoCal residents drive to Vegas, dine at a place off the strip once and enjoy the entire experience of dinning at a Moroccan Restaurant

Wow this place is great.  No menus, $60 a person, Belly Dancers, Authentic Atmosphere... doesn't even feel like your still in Vegas.  The food which was 6 courses melted in my mouth.  I can't believe I'm saying this, but as much as I loved the steak, I HAVE to find out what sauce the fruit was smothered in.  Its not even right.  I literally was full after the 4th course and couldn't stop eating because itw as so good.  We went with a big group, but I would def take a girl there that enjoys good culture.  Maybe not the high-maintence bottle-service only type.

We loved the place.  The location is in a strip mall and so you're not sure what it's going to be like.  Parking lot was full so we parked in the back lot.  It's surprisingly close to the strip.  

The food was soooo good.  the Lentil soup was amazing.  It was seasoned so well.  The hummus was just ok but having the fresh cucumber and carrots with it was nice (vs. pita bread).  The shrimp dish was my favorite.  Absolutely delicious.  I could have eaten that all night.  Then the final course, the chicken w/ the couscous was good but shrimp was better.  Ask for the hot sauce.  It's soooo good.  

I had a bite of the dessert which was good and the tea they give you is even better.  I'm normally not a fan of tea but it was really yummy.

For the price of the food and the entertainment and the vibe, I thought it was a wonderful experience.  It's something different from all the fancy steak houses on the strip.  We loved it and I would totally go back.

What a class act!!!  Took a big family group to dinner in March.  The food was great.  Big portions, and good value. The dancers are very talented, and made the nephews in our group blush.  

My bad:  when I got home, I found that I had double tipped them, as I didn't notice (in the dark room) that the gratuity was included in the bill.  I was lazy, and did nothing to follow up with the restaurant.  Just got my visa bill.  They took the double tip off without even being asked.  Wow.  NEVER had that happen before.

Every food course was amazing, especially the chicken.  Their belly dancer was outstanding and the service was wonderful.  Be sure to pace yourself for all six courses.  The portions are very generous.  Have fun and enjoy the authentic atmosphere.

I had heard of Marrakech and been wanting to go there for about a year already. My Birthday finally came around and i thought what better way to celebrate it then at Marrakech!!! Oh how wrong i was!

 the food was bland and really nothing exciting might of even tasted like something thrown together in 15 min. My  waiter made it an even worst experience ever. Making some racial Comments is so uncalled for and how very unprofessional. He was a more heavy set guy who is Cuban i believe. 

The food was being rushed.  the shrimp scampi was removed from my table when i had literally put the last shrimp in my mouth then i sipped my lentil soup when the Zalook and Hummus appeared. i dipped in maybe twice when the kabbobs and cous cous was already there and my humus was gone...before i new it everything was wrapped in a box to go all i needed was for someone to tell me ,DONT LET THE DOOR HIT YOUR BUT !!

 I will never go here again. One time for me is all it takes. It seems like it has great reviews from many pple but from what i see this place does have a problem with the customer service part. Tip to Waiter Keep the racial comments to your self Buddy. I will be telling all my friends about this place and what bad experience i had . i give Marrakech A BIG THUMBS DOWN!!!!

You walk in, it's very dark, the waiter leads you to a table that is the height of your knees. You literally have to hunch over to eat and who wants to eat some nasty stew with BONES in it in the dark?? Just gross! The lady dances for way too long, you feel like you have to give her all of your attention. It's a dirty overpriced uncomfortable place to eat. Needless to say, I don't suggest it.

Growing up in a moroccan household, this restaurant makes me feel like im visiting my family. Everything from the food to the atmosphere is simply amazing. This restaurant NEVER disappoints! Dont think twice - you'll love it!

Marrakech is THE ultimate date spot, great for a gathering of friends you haven't seen in awhile, or simply a spectacular experience! I have been going here for years and have enjoyed excellent food and fantastic service every time. 

The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated and I love the low tables and cushion-like seating. The servers are all warm and timely in refilling wine and water while juggling all the courses of delish food and the belly dancers are always wonderful too! Bring some cash to tip the dancer and be prepared for her to teach you a move or two!

The food is absolutely amazing and you cannot beat the price anywhere in town! Course after course is beautifully presented to the table and everything tastes amazing! I cannot pick a favorite course so make sure that you arrive with a big appetite. 

Overall this place is a gem that I tell friends, family, and tourists alike that they MUST go!!!

My family and friends went in to celebrate a birthday. We had such an amazing time! The food was absolutely delicious. The service was spot on. To top
It off the belly dancers got my daughter up to dance with them. We had such a great time! We will definitely be back!

So happy we came across this place during the AILA convention. The environment, food, and service is beyond excellent. You need to try the shrimp dish. Definitely coming back for the party they have on Saturdays.

Angel:  4 Stars: Very intimate and sensual atmosphere. We were greeted by a typical male Las Vegas nightclub host; seeing that we were dining at a venue that promotes itself as an authentic Moroccan restaurant, I found him to be quite out of place. Upon entering Marrakech we found ourselves submerged into a relaxing, and tantalizing ambiance. If you select the basic option you are given three courses, including a dessert. I had a glass of Amazir red, a Moroccan wine, that paired nicely with my meal. This is definitely a delightful place for couples and groups. They had really gorgeous belly dancers who were very "skilled" at their profession, Lol. But make sure that if you are brave enough to shake it with these ladies that you have "CASH AT HAND" and tip accordingly :o)

Before you are served your hands are cleaned in a cute sort of ritualistic manner. Eating with your hands enhances the overall experience. If you are an average size lady, the portions may be a little big for you. However, I found myself falling in love more and more with every bite. The dessert was too much, but the overall meal kept my taste buds very excited. The servers weren't the most talkative, but I'm not sure if that was a cultural thing and that's just how Moroccan food is presented? Its also very easy to lose track of time, which makes this a great mini escape from Vegas without leaving Vegas.


Alex: 4 stars. I've never had authentic Moroccan food, so I'm unqualified to compare. All I can say is that I was thoroughly impressed with the taste. Very flavorful and well-prepared. We ordered the three-dish meal for $25 each (a solid deal) which came with cooked veggies and dip, chicken with couscous, and dessert. I had no complaints whatsoever about the food. The dancers were great, and made sure to keep the entire restaurant engaged; bring cash for tips to show your appreciation for their talent. The atmosphere is extremely laid back. Dance with the dancers, laugh, drink, be merry. I guess what keeps it from being a true 5-star for me is two things: First, though I love the belly-dancing music, between shows it slips into cheesy Vegas techno and kills the beautiful atmosphere they've created with the interior design and lighting. Second is the Welcome-Factor of the waiters. There is none. It's kind of a "done yet?" feeling.

Take friends, take in the atmosphere, and enjoy the delicious food...you don't wanna miss this place!

Yes, the food was good. Yes, the ambiance was fabulous. Yes, the entertainers were splendid but, being made to feel like family was priceless. Every time we return to Las Vegas we will make sure to visit Marrakech Moroccan Restaurant. We had a spectacular time!

This place was awesome really neat ambiance the belly dancers were very interactive and got the crowd dancing. As for the food it was definitely a lot by the time we got to the main entree we were stuffed. Would definitely recommend this place!
Simply the best! The shrimp was to die for and the dessert was awesome! Best Mediterranean food in Vegas!

I think I speak for myself when I say dining should be not only a palatable experience but a moral one. Now, where I'm from taking a 9 yr. old bride is not kosher, and neither is a middle-aged man preying on younger women on social media, especially women whose chastity is bound by an oath to God. Now what does that have to do with Marrakech's food? Absolutely nothing, I think.

The chicken I ordered was sprinkled with nuts of some sort. Now, I'm a fairly uneducated man, and to be frank, this ignorance is quite uninhibited, but I do think this chicken's integrity is compromised by such a gratuitous sprinkling of cashews, almonds and walnuts. The sauce was a curry, I think, and yellow, like the sort of "man" that fishes women out of their hijab with artful keystrokes and the peacock exuberance of wealth acquired young but earned a few generations ago. Bootstraps come cheaper when your parents couldn't ever be caught dead scraping bitumen out of a barrel for a colonial pound a week.

Also, the most palatable spice to the food here is the triple-filtered tap water and the midriffs swishing around our table-tents. 

The food is okay, the atmosphere is loud, and I'm talking a melange of Indian funk and the gut-wrenching undertones of pedophilia consorting with a babble of PIE languages and the smell of caterpillar smoke.
The atmosphere and service is great and the food is awesome!! Went once and I am hooked.

Great restaurant.  Husband & I were visiting Las Vegas, had never had Moroccan food, so we decided to give this a try.

We had NO idea what to expect, so we were seated & sat around like goons for a minute (despite the fact that the restaurant has a big placard right inside the front door describing what to expect).  

As mentioned in most reviews, this is a prix fixe menu (about $40 a person) serving six courses.  No menu necessary.  

Everything was very good.  The highlight was the 'salad' (really more of an appetizer plate, but described on the menu as salad, and served as the third course), with beets, carrots, hummus, tzatziki, and olives.  Loved it.  The steak skewers were also fabulous.  The chicken and couscous was pretty bland, but by that time, we were so stuffed with great food that we could forgive this.

Also worth note - the dessert.  Holy cow.  I'm not a big fan of dessert, but this was amazing...a huge plate of something similar to baklava.  Lots of phyllo dough with walnuts, honey, some type of fruit (pear?  apple?) and baked.  And lots of it!  Yyeeaahh!!!

Service was good...they just kept bringing the food.  My husband thought the belly dancer was great & wished that she had performed more than once in the hour & a half that she was there.

I'm a fan!

We went here looking for something unusual and were pleasantly surprised with the really excellent and tasty food quality.  As other reviews note, tons of good food.  Prix-fix menu.  First course, shrimp scampi, was happily devoured by all.  The soup dish was the "ho-hum" course; nothing bad but not very interesting either.  The hummus / baba ganoush course was really high quality with bonus flourishes like olives and marinated carrots to take it up a notch.  Meat skewers were really tender, very above average.  Chicken cous-cous was a bit "ho-hum" for me but others in my family insisted it was amazing.  All this in a cozy setting (looks like you are in a tent) and multiple performances by some rather sexy belly dancers who I think did a good job keeping the female guests (e.g. my wife) feeling engaged and part of the fun.

This is a fun experience just off the strip in Vegas. A six course pre-fix Moroccan feast and the food is delicious. Pace yourself as you will not leave hungry. Belly dancing is included as part of the fun. The restaurant is decorated so that you feel you are sitting in a Sultan's tent. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Great way to end my trip to Vegas. This place is awesome! Excellent food and customer service! Definitely coming here again! :)
Great food and great service! Perfect date spot if you arent worried about price. Definitely call and make a reservation.
Love going here, the food is awesome! It is decorated like a Moroccan tent and can't forget about the belly dancing! so much fun

A must visit when in Las Vegas.  It was nice to get off the strip for an evening out.  The ambiance is cozy and lounge like.  It is a 6 course pre fix meal for $49; worth every penny.
Come hungry as the portions are large.  We began with our hands being washed with rose water; a wonderful touch.  Ordered a red wine by the bottle which was very good; a recommendation from the waiter.  Keep your bread so you can dip it and enjoy it with all the dishes.  The belly dancer was great ~ she came out twice when we were there; and was very talented.  Feel free to tip her!   We will definitely return.

Had dinner there with our family the Wed night before Thanksgiving.  We felt bad for making a late reservation (8:45pm), but when we called they assured us it was no problem.  They were very accommodating as we had a late addition for a party of 9.

The waiters were nice.  Service was good.  The mojito wasn't that great, but the wine was good and reasonably priced.  

I've never had Moroccan before, but love Mediterranean food, so was optimistic.  The food at Marrakech was great.  We did the prefix and everything as really good.  Started with a soup, then hummus plate, then shrimp, a chicken dish, and desert.  There was way more food than needed, but they were nice about letting us take the leftovers home so as not to go to waste.  

They also had a belly dancer, which was pretty cool.  Although it was a bit uncomfortable as we didn't really know what the etiquette is for tipping.  We gave her a few singles, and she seems to appreciate it.  So hope we did the right thing.  

With food, wine, and tip it came out to be about $70 per person, which I think is reasonable.   Overall I'd definitely recommend Marrakech.  Good food and experience.

Food was great and lots of it! Belly dancing was a nice extra. Good service. The only dish we had issues with was the chicken plate, it was very bland and was the only dish that we didn't have seconds of.

We spent the New Year's 2012 eve there. It WAS a unique dining experience alright - nevermore, thank you. Not fun. Not tasty. Disappointing in every respect.  
My husband is Moroccan. Naturally I had high expectations for the place knowing the taste of Moroccan cuisine. Trust me, the taste of dishes could not have been more disappointing. How can you guys call yourself Moroccan restaurant when you cook the cous-cous without the basic ingredients?!?! The cous-cous we had was cooked without pumpkin, potato and chickpeas!! Only cabbage. Well, some slices of carrots, too. While It's the Traditional Moroccan dish! Unbelievable... 
Now for the dessert. Bastilla filed with chocolate and banana? Where did you get that recipe? It's a BAD mix of Moroccan and American tastes, if this is whet you were attempting to recreate. Hardly eatable... 
Now for the famous mint tea. We were not served that at all. Guess, they have decided that free champagne is a good substitute. Well, it was not. By the way, from the color of tea we saw being poured to a couple from another table, we can assume that it is not the best-tasting Moroccan tea either.     
As for the entertainment, the dancing lady was lovely! BUT if we had entered the restaurant 10 minutes later - we would have missed her completely. And that was the ONLY entertainment offered for the New Year's eve. Don't even want to mention the music screaming as loudly as it only could from the speakers above our ears. And it was some stupid pop songs, not even a hint to oriental tunes!! Or was it a special offer due to the New Year's eve? Another bad idea, gentlemen.  
The entourage is shocking at first as everyone are sitting in front of each other, in one large hall. But you get used to it, so OK for a change.  
All in all, we could NOT have been more disappointed by the restaurant. It by no means cost $140. The only reason why I asked the waited to pack the remains of our food to-go, was cuz I wanted to give the bastilla and the cous-cous another chance by eating them at home. It did not help...

Highly recommend this place. Intimate, exotic, with good food and great service. They took care of our 19 person group with grace and aplomb, despite our musical chairs-like mingling and special dietary needs. Family style food was generous in portions and really good. It's ambiance is warm and romantic without being cloying or claustrophobic. The belly dancers add great entertainment and atmosphere and are never obnoxious or in the way of conversation and enjoyment of the evening. Great for big groups or small.
This place is a must visit when in Vegas. I always highly recommend this place to everyone I know that goes to Vegas. Not once has it let me down, food is delicious but the atmosphere is priceless.

My relatives are visiting from Japan and I decided to treat them to Marrakech for dinner. They are thoroughly impressed and satisfied with the high quality service, the exquisite food, and the unique experience.  Marrakech is an amazing dining experience. The chef, Elias, is very talented and prepares the most delicious cuisine imaginable. Our host, Hany, is great! The service that he provides is top of the line. Aradia, the belly dancer, gave a fun and engaging performance.  We love the Marrakech team!

What a fun and great place to have a wonderful five course meal, light hearted entertainment and good conversation with friends.  It feels like you are in Morocco.  Nicely done, like being in a tent in the Sahara.  The food was fantastic.  Especially liked the skewered meat.  The Moorish hospitality was excellent with washing of hands before and oil on the hands after.  The mint tea was great.  Drank three pots.  It was relaxing and enjoyable.  Have been there six times for birthdays, holidays and just time to spend with family and friends.  I would highly recommend the place.  I love it.  Will be back.

I absolutely love this place! I have been coming here since I was about 10 years old. The owner is awesome and attractive:). The ambience is great, and the food is traditional and always delicious. The food is a little pricy, but for a six course meal, belly dancers, and one of the only Moroccan restaurants I know of, I think it's pretty reasonable. If you decide to eat here, you must have an open mind. You eat Moroccan style with your hands, the seats are low to the ground, and the restaurant is designed to look like a tent upon entering. The cornish game hen (not chicken as it has been referred to in numerous posts) is one of the best dishes. However, it is the 5th course, so make sure you leave enough room to try it!

Wow. I'm blown away with how tasty their food is. Being a vegan and was out with meat lover friends, it was great how we could all be around each other and eat whatever we want. Staff is amazing. Love the inside, makes me want to go to Morocco! 5 stars!

Every time I'm in Vegas with people who are new, I always want to take them to Marrakech...and for me who is a decidedly indecisive person, a fixed menu is perfect. 

Basics, dimly lit, good for groups (make a reservation...this is good too because there's plenty of food to go around), loud (esp every 30 min when the belly dancing starts up). You will definitely be propositioned at least once during the meal to dance with the belly dancer, and hey! why not? :) You're in Vegas and what happens here stays here right?

I would come here just for the experience, takes about 2 hours. And if not for the experience, for the DESSERT! Gooey, hot amalgamation of bananas, chocolate and slivered almonds wrapped in phyllo dough, baked up to a flaky moon of perfection and covered with a heaping helping of powdered sugar and cocoa powder.

TIP: come hungry, bring friends, don't eat everything that you see since you probably want to save room for the rest of the meal.

Gluten Free: also, came with a friend who was allergic to gluten. They asked at the beginning of the meal and make entirely separate dishes to make it gluten free. That's an automatic plus one star for me. Sadly the dessert I mentioned above was cold and chunky since phyllo dough was out of the question so it was not baked, but otherwise still tasty.

Food need a revamp, it looks like a mess and taste bland...shame, because Moroccan food is full of flavor, this restaurant used to be great few years ago, now it's all about belly dancing and liquor.  Too bad...maybe it's time for a real moroccan restaurant in Vegas
Went here for my friends birthday a few months ago . Absolutely love the food , the lentil soup is my favorite

I held my wedding reception here last month and it was the best decision! Tariq, the owner of Marrakech, helped me get everything set up the way I wanted it. He even touched base with me a couple of times before the date. I honestly didn't stress about a thing. Extra communication = happy bride/customer :) 

The food was delicious and the portions were HUGE. The shrimp scampi was my personal favorite. The steak was cooked perfectly. And the banana chocolate pastry + mint tea was a great end to the meal. It felt great to hang out with everyone in our own section, as opposed to sitting around a stuffy reception hall. 

The service was wonderful. Several of my guests had questions and the servers were more than happy to explain the different dishes. The ambiance and belly dancers were the cherry on top. Everyone left with full bellies and told me they had the best time. After running around all day, my husband and I were happy to just relax and spent time with our loved ones. 

So basically... if you've got a special event coming up, talk to Tariq. He'll take care of you and make sure you have an absolutely wonderful evening. Thank you again!

My girlfriend and I came here to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and had a wonderful experience. The food, atmosphere, and service was excellent. We ordered the 6 course dinner which was amazing. It was definitely a memorable experience.

Impressed! Company party so we had the 6-course meal and it was delicious!! 
No utensils and we had a blast!!
Enjoyed the belly dancer and the music set the tone in a good way. 
A must!!

This is a quiet little gem on Paradise. I've been to its neighbor ,Firefly, a bazillion times and always wondered what lingered to the south. Now I know and this will be a must for out of town guests.

Bellydancers while binging on beef kabobs? Why not?

One of the most pleasant surprises involves rose water. The other tea.

I want to give this place 4 stars, but I'll have to give it 3 for the following two reasons:
1) Only two prix fixe menu: a six course for $39.95, or a three course for $24.95
2) The food is good, but not amazing. Definitely not the best hummus, cous cous, or kebabs I've had, but still good.

I had the three course menu, which has two options. The first is soup, salad, and then the entree. The second is salad, entree, and then the dessert. I don't really have a sweet tooth, so I went with the former.

The soup was a lentil soup, that came with some bread. The bread was nothing special, but I thought the lentil soup was excellent, especially since I'm not a fan of lentils. The salad was basically some carrots, olives, and cucumbers with hummus and a eggplant sauce/hummus. I enjoyed both and thought it was definitely above average. For the entree, I had roasted chicken and vegetables over some cous cous. The cous cous was excellent, flavorful and moist, while the chicken was just decent. 

The real star of the meal was the pot of mint tea I ordered. Slightly on the sweet side, but it was some of the best mint tea I've ever had. Highly recommended. 

TL;DR: Get the mint tea; the food is good, but a little pricy.

ive never had moroccan food before, i met a girlfriend there for dinner. she knew the owner of the place. He was very nice and helpful, great costumer service. he sat us right away. its couch seating with a little round table in front of you. they have belly dancers that come out and perform. they bring out a bunch of different dishes. shrimp, coos coos, amazing dessert, kabob with different types of meat. a tomato based soup. everything you eat with your hands. the drinks were nice and strong. very nice experience, had a lot of fun and food was delicous. ill definatley be going back

One of the BEST places in Vegas to celebrate with a group or bring out of town guests!  Have had WONDERFUL experiences here since I was a little girl.  Recently though, they did a private luncheon (40 men & women) for Admin Day for my work and what a hit!  They were very accommodating to our group's needs and really helped me tailor the experience to our celebration.  Everyone LOVED the food and the belly dancing!

My friends and I had dinner here last summer and what a memorable experience it was! It's been over a year and we still talk about it. We made a reservation for 5 people and were seated at a nice corner table. The waiter was welcoming, courteous and friendly. We ordered their fixed price 6 course menu, which I believe was $45 per person, and a bottle of Moroccan wine - all absolutely delicious. 

First came their Shrimp Scampi sautéed in lemon. Then the Lentil soup, the hummus plate, and a couple other dishes. All amazing, tasteful and flavorful. For dessert, they brought some pastry cake stuffed with bananas and chocolate and we couldn't get enough! A belly dancer danced around while we were eating and was quite entertaining. We had a great time. 

We're all looking forward to go back on our next trip to Vegas. Must check out!
I got the groupon. The food was great. I was way full and satisfied. The dancers were fun. The waiter was rude but I could overlook that because everything else was perfect.
Great courses of food, I loved the shrimp scampi. The belly dance was enjoyable but I don't really like middle eastern / Indian music so was ok.

A-OK is definitely where this place sits.  My biggest gripe is the lack of a menu selection.  I am allergic to seafood and don't eat hummus or cornish game hens so there went half the meal.  What I did eat was delish.  After tax and tip it comes out to about $55 a person which is incredibly steep if you don't eat every single piece of food put in front of you.  One of the other reviewers outlined the courses and that's still accurate.  The beef kebabs are incredible and the soup was good.  

The entertainment is fun.  Thy have a middle eastern dancing girl who periodically comes out in in costume and belly dances.  It's fun and sexy but still something the kids can see.  She's very engaging and has enough savvy to engage the people who want to be engaged while still understanding that no from us 'sticks in the mud' means no.  This is definitely worth visiting at least once.  It's an experience!

Loved it, had a great time!

The ambiance and the belly dancing were wonderful.

The food was great too. 

Definitely a fun place to spend an evening.
the ambience was amazing...the staff were very professional and the food can't get enough stars. the in dining entertainment featuring the beautiful belly dancer displayed taste at its finest.

I can't believe it's almost and year since my wedding day. My wife asked what were my plans for our 1st ann. dinner. My answer simply Marrakech!! Where we held our Wedding day reception at,  Many of our guest are still talking about the FOOD, SHRIMP, MINT TEA, DESERT AND EVEN THE BREAD This place is the true GEM of Las Vegas! 
Never had a bad moment in this Sultan's palace, that's the way they make all their guests feel.
I have been enjoying here for the past 15 years, Ali and his family are the BEST!
Each course better than the next ! Needless to say every March we'll be there! 
GO ENJOY TIP YOUR BELLY DANCERS !!

We haven't been here for a few years and I think it's new owners the outside is more inviting and the inside and music isn't as dated as it used to be. The food and staff was wonderful and we were even entertained by a very nice belly dancer. It's a 6 course meal that can't be beat for $50 per person and the wine is fairly priced too. This a a great romantic spot to bring your date. Just come hungry the amount of food you receive is a little overwhelming.  No it may not be for family's it's really a romantic spot. So if your looking to bring your family with kids this probably isn't the place for you. It's an experience, a show, fine dining and a true gem!

OMG!!! Phenomenal in every way! Start to finish. 
Loved it here! The interior was fabulous.
The food was excellent. Portion sizes were huge. 
The entertainment was outstanding. 
These women are beautiful! They know how to dance!! And their figures are healthy! What women should be! 
We will be dining here again!

Awesome! If you want to try something fun and different I highly recommend it. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 star instead of 5 is that I think it is a little overpriced. But other than that, great food (6 course meal), friendly staff that worked with my wife to provide a vegetarian option. They even have belly dancers starting at 6ish about every hour. Will be going back.

Can you say a fun spot ? Was getting wined and dined for a business dinner and we didn't even need to with the fair pricing ! Loved the whole vibe of the restaurant and our waitress, Stephanie was adorable and knowledgeable. Will likely be one of our new Vegas hangouts !

Went for my fiance's birthday this past weekend with some out-of-town friends. It was unique- you step into a "Moroccan tent" and has a great ambiance. The food was very good (shrimp scampi and the filet mignon were exceptional). Unfortunately, the service was something left to be desired. Our main waiter was not very attentive and was slightly rude at times. As a paying customer ($45 pp) I definitely expected more in the way of service. Not likely to return again.

A wonderful dining experience while in Las Vegas. 

I've been to Marrakech Morroccan Restaurant twice in the last two years, both times were very enjoyable experiences. They serve a fixed price menu containing several dishes. It's a good idea to be hungry when you arrive. The chicken cous cous really stood out from the other dishes. The chicken fell off the bone, and the sauce that came with it was subtle and delicious. The Morrocan Mojito's are delicious, and a nice 16oz glass for $14. 

The staff was attentive (almost too eager to clear our plates when we were taking a pause due to our overloaded bellies), and very friendly. 

The belly dancing is outstanding, and there is lots of audience participation. Good vibes and great food at the Marrakech. Plan to spend about 2 hours there to get the full experience.

The minute you walk in it's like you've stepped into a tent in the middle of the dessert. Which, I guess, is kind of true. Anyway, we had Opentable reservations (definitely try and make reservations because the restaurant is small and they are often sold out completely for the evening) and a Groupon. We opted for the six course meal (we had fasted in preparation) but still could not eat all of it. While it's not commonly advertised, they do a smaller prix fix and an a la cart menu as well, so if you're not prepared for the six courses, ask or they probably won't tell you about it. The inside of the restaurant is amazing and beautiful; it really makes the ambiance fun and probably even makes the food taste better (not that it needs to, it's wonderful too). Every course was great even though we couldn't eat all of it and they do have utensils too, thankfully. The dancers were fun to watch and they weren't too pushy in getting people to dance (usually the drunk or bald guys would get picked on). The music when the dancers weren't present was at a great volume for talking. My friend and I had a great time, it was a wonderful experience and a lot of fun.

Amazing ambiance. This is definitely one of the top restaurants I recommend to people, as it's one of my favorites. Unfortunately some people don't like to live a little and get all weirded out when I explain it to them... pshhh. Their shrimp scampi is TO DIE FOR! I love every course, from start to finish. Washing your hands with rose water is a lovely touch, and you can't forget the guys who know how to pour tea! And who doesn't like watching the lovely belly dancers?! Some belly dancers seem to be more skilled than others, but it's always fun nonetheless! Have been coming here for over 10 years and hope they continue to keep things top notch!

Tacky and Unrefined....but I'm not talking about Chicken Wings...


This Moroccan restaurant has figured out a working business model.  They use the lack of other Moroccan restaurants in the area, plus belly dancers, plus interesting decor, all to distract customers from the sub par food and poor service.  

We did the 6 course tasting menu for $40.  Much of the food tasted like it was sitting out at a buffet, and some unhappy waiter just brought it to our table.  For the money that you will spend here, you can actually go to a good buffet, even though you may have to get the food yourself.  

The mint tea at the end of the meal was heavenly.  It was soothing, and left a very pleasant taste on my palette, which helped distract from the other flavors that were there prior.  


If you're looking for dinner and a show, get some Teppenyaki.  If you want mediocre food while eating in what feels like a magic lamp, I guess you found the right place.  

There is nothing magical about this lamp, and no genie either.  You've been warned.

Absolutely one of the best restaurant and entertainment experience I and all of my friends have ever had. The service and entertainment was superior and the food was incredible! Worth every penny although for 4 people it was only $45 per person which is a steal considering the incredible environment, ambiance and entertainment available here with impeccable taste, decor, style, and flair.
We will now make this a regular stop to our trek to Las Vegas. You will not be disappointed unless you don't like good food and fantastic entertainment.

One word: AWESOME!!! =D

I was in Vegas last week for my best friend's bachelorette/birthday weekend. While planning, we needed to figure out a dinner location that would fit the occasion, not too expensive and had a prefix meal. I came across Marraheck Moroccan, got the bride to be's approval and made a reservation. When we arrived at the restaurant, it was as though we were transported to a fancy tent in Morroca, the decorations were beautiful and there was a lot of drapery. We had a little issue with the seating at first because they had us all side on couches on one side of the table (not very good for conversation) and when we asked to be switched to another table or for more chairs on the other side of the table, our waiter was not accomedating, so I went and grabbed chairs from another table so that we could have 3 girls on one side of the table and 4 girls on the other side. HOWEVER, i must say that our waiter made up for his original rudeness because when we ordered our meal, we told him that we had one vegan and one girl who cannot eat cinammon, he made sure that their meals fitted their needs. There were two belly dancers who performed during the night, super fun to watch. Especially when we pushed our bride to be to go dance. We got the 6 course meal, and wow...everything was absolutely delicious! We were going clubbing after dinner, so I didn't plan on eating too much since I didn't want to have a little belly, but I COULD NOT stop eatting! Everything was just sooo good! When dessert came, they made a small one with no cinnamon and one vegan one to accomedate the the diets of the allergic and vegan. That was super nice of them to do that. I forgot to mention the yelp deal so we didn't get the 15% discount, but I was so happy with the meal that I don't care. It was a great meal, great ambiance, and great people =).

I made a yelp account just to write this restaurant a review. If I could give them ZERO stars I would! My parents were going to Vegas for the first time to celebrate their 25th anniversary, and this is the first time they have gone on a trip together with just the two of them (having 4 kids makes it difficult for them to get away!) 

Well, I saw the great reviews for this restaurant and a groupon deal so I bought it as a gift for them. They showed up to the restaurant and the RUDE lady at the front told them that since they didn't have a reservation, they can't eat there, and that if they wanted to eat there they would have to come back ANOTHER DAY and that there were other restaurants in the area and that they should try something else. WHAT THE F WORD!??? My poor parents, who are not used to taking cabs (we live in the suburbs) asked if they could help call them a cab, and they said yeah we'll call someone but you're going to have to wait outside. THEY WOULDN'T EVEN LET MY PARENTS WAIT INSIDE FOR A CAB!! It's December, winter, and I double checked the website and did not see mandatory reservation required anywhere!!!! While they waited outside for 45 mins, people walking by looked and stared and no cab ever came. My dad had to go hail a cab outside in the main streets for them.

They decided to go to this restaurant on a weds night at 6:30, and were rudely turned away and after cabbing here from their hotel, had to cab back. My mom said she has never felt so lowly, degraded, and embarrassed before from this awful customer service and it was a horrible way to end their 25th anniversary. Really Marrakech... no room on a WEDNESDAY night to fit in 2 people?! And asking them to leave your restaurant? I will be writing the owner a letter. SO DISAPPOINTED!

saw Philip's review a month or so ago and it reminded me ( after eating at firefly and dragonfly several times ) that i need to hit this place. 

'm trying to figure out how this place makes $$. The price is very reasonable for what you get. i liked everything - especially the shrimp and the chicken - it ain't high end stuff but decent . 

my roomie was convinced the dancer was trying to pick-up on me - all i can say is, IN MY DREAMS !! She did make a point to come by after the dance to talk to me - one of those, " don't i know you from somewhere ? " 

thank god, it turns out she's a friend of a friend , then again, i think it might have been more fun/interesting if she was trying to pick up on me !

If i had to arrange for a lively dinner for a group, this place is in my top 5 - especially if $$ is an issue.

Happy Eating !

You will not be disappointed!!!

Great ethnic Moroccan cuisine, belly dancers, beautiful atmosphere. Wish I could eat like this everyday. The price might seem high at first, but I swear it is worth every penny!
food was good definitely different from my culture. Everyone recieved a six different dish

TL;DR - Overpriced and underspiced.

Cons: Not worth $40 for dinner. Maybe $30, but still pushing it for me.The soup was clearly from a can - tasted like cheap Campbell's vegetable soup to me, no flavor, had that tin taste. Bread was okay, nothing special, clearly purchased from a factory. Everything was underspiced and a little bland, which sucks because one of the things I love (and expect!) about food from this region is the flavor. The red wine I had was good, but not $11/glass good. Maybe $6.

Pros: kebabs were yummy, put a couple drops of lemon juice on them for a different flavor. Can't go wrong with hummus and cucumbers. The shrimp (though a bit tough) had a nice sauce. Dessert was yummy and went well with coffee (they give you mint tea, but ask for the coffee instead). Chicken was pretty good. Large portions, my party of 3 had plenty of food to go around. Decor was lovely and the dancing girls were a crowd pleaser. Service was spot on.

I think this was once a nice restaurant experience with authentic food, but management was losing money or wanted to make more money so they cut corners with the food. Typical, but sad. Marrakesh, make a fresh soup and your own bread. Stop outsourcing. Add a little love and flavor into the food. You're not doing yourselves any favors by Americanizing your menu. Sure, you advertise and get the tourists... but what about the locals like myself who would make it a regular thing if you had better food? Do you want someone to spend money once or many times?

Until they get their kitchen in order and their chef in line, I won't be back.

The husband took me here for my birthday and we both enjoyed the entertainment and food.  We loved everything about this place. The restaurant was very cozy and intimate. They even pour rose water over your hands so you can wash them at your table.  The experience itself was hands down amazing!

Now you gotta come here HUNGRY cause they do offer a 6 course meal (yes 6 courses) and I must say, by the time we got to the main course we were FULL. Probably our fault since we loaded on the Morroccan bread ;) But that bread dipped in the shrimp scampi sauce...heaven!  I especially loved their hummus and babaganoush plate. If you're like me and love roasted eggplant, you'll love the babaganoush - it was packed with so much flavor! The beef kabobs were so yummy that I wished they offered more especially since I thought that was the main course, but I was wrong. The main course came after and honestly, we were already stuffed we just couldn't eat anymore. Which was okay since I wasn't too impressed with the chicken and couscous. The chicken was on the dry side and I think the only thing I enjoyed was the veggies on the plate. But if you love sweets, you'll love their dessert though.  It reminded me of a huge baklava puffed up. It was yummy!

Now for the entertainment, the main reason the husband took me here for my birthday - the belly dancers. It was the first time for both of us and it was fun! There were two dancers that night. We did get up and dance with one of the dancers. It was a fun experience since she was teaching both of us how to belly dance :) She made the experience even better. 

All in all I would definitely recommend this place. From the service we received, to the entertainment and to the food.
Excellent food, wine, entertainment, atmosphere and dining experience! I have been here about 50 times!

I would give it 5 stars but it nearly put a hole in my pocket ($40/person). It was my bad since I didn't look at the price menu before walking in BUTI left SA-TIS-FIED! When I was working in Vegas, I discovered this spot one night when a friend and I were just feeling some Mediterranean food.

It was a six course meal that left me wanting more and more and more....MMmmm the Shrimp Scampi were delish! The game hen was so tender and savory, the meat just fell right of the bones and into my salivating mouth. The hummus with veggies were also to die for. The belly dancer were entertaining as well. 

I only wish that they had lunch specials or something for half price during the day, you know without all the oohhs and ahhhs, entertainment, and fancy shamancy shiet. I'm selfish. I know. I just want to be able to afford you in this economic crisis....

It's hard to pick a place solely based on reviews and I was iffy ... but we went and it was awesome!!!!!!  Food was amazing and potions plentiful, service was great, ambience was exactly what I was hoping for! Small and intimate -a definite must-experience!!
Great Moroccan food and service. They have six courses dinner so delicious for $50 a bit expensive but worth it. Remember six courses enough for two ..

After lunch at Firefly we looked up Marrakech which was in the same strip mall. Unfortunately we were flying out that day. Fortunately, our flight was delayed 3 hours so we cabbed it from the airport here, had a delicious 6-course meal for $40, a unique experience, and got on the plane happily full. The only other places like this is one i can think of in LA, where there are belly dancers and the ceremonial-like hand washing as well as pouring of the Moroccan mint tea!
The belly dancer was actually asian but whatever. she was good and entertaining, and she came out occasionally so it wasn't overboard. My fave course was the chicken couscous. It filled me up after multiple dishes of non-hot appetizer-like dishes (all very good but nothing like steaming hot food). The dessert was over-the-top and huge for us 2. It was warm, made with sliced bananas, chocolate, flaky goodness, and sprinkled with confectionary sugar and cinnamon. so darn good! we couldn't finish it. Would def go back. Great for an adventurous date and a pretty authentic meal in Vegas. Next time, all my meals will be on Paradise Drive.
Everyone was so nice and very avoid sting for my gluten allergy. I can't wait to go back. Loved seeing the belly dancers and an amazing atmosphere. I love the ambience of the culture as well.

I felt like I was eating and lounging in a genie bottle.

The atmosphere was dimly lit with booths and tables low to the ground.  My friend took a few of us girls to this spot and we ordered the 6 course pre-fixe menu.  We ate with our hands and shared everything.  They bring out food portioned to the size of your party.  My favorite course was the 5th, which was slow cooked chicken with couscous.

A belly dancer came out twice during our one and a half hour stay and we tipped her dollars in her belt and she seduced the crowd with her grace and talented body control.  She was amazing and the experience as a whole was unlike any other.

Jiggy jiggy jiggy... that's the shake of the belly dancer that entertains as you begin to embark on an amazing 6-course meal at Marrakech.

If you're feeling adventurous, or just need a break from the Vegas strip, make your way here. It's not too far but far enough that you forget about the chaos that's just around the corner.

Located in a non-descript shopping plaza, you wouldn't realize you were actually about to be transported to Morrocco itself. The decor is amazing - you are in a tent! The tables are low, everything is authentic... nothing big-box manufactured.

We opted for the 6-course meal and I assure it's a lot of amazing food and it's great because it leaves all the thinking to the restaurant and yes, they have a vegetarian option.

Here's the breakdown:
1st course: sautéed shirmp (mushrooms for me) in a garlic butter/white wine reduction sauce.. O.M.G. I ASKED FOR BREAD SO I WOULDN'T NEED A STRAW TO DRINK THE SAUCE.

2nd course: lentil soup. Was really well flavored... you could really taste the cumin, fennel seeds.. it was vegetarian. Oddly they didn't give you utensils... but now that I am thinking about it, we didn't use utensils throughout the meal.. (ah, now that wonderful rose hand wash at the beginning of the meal makes so much sense).

3rd course - kebobs served on a pineapple. Delish and perfectly cooked

4th course: hummus, babaganoush - good hummus. I think it was more of a palette cleanser

5th course: chicken and couscous - wowza. The chicken (according to the hubster) fell off the bone. The couscous was really good too... cooked in a saffron broth

6th course: I can't even begin to explain what this was... it was like a bakalava, banana pie cake thing of amazing-ness. I wish I had more room for it.

So go... pack your stretchy pants and dancing shoes (because you must dance with the belly dancer), venture off the strip and go to Morroco.

POSITIVES:

Great Service  - Our server, Ali, made this a top notch experience.  He was pleasant, charming, attentive, quick, and very accommodating.  

Good Food - Some of the 7 items were hits and some were miss, but overall the meal was satisfying.  The shrimp seemed a bit overcooked, it was almost rubbery.  The soup that followed was like canned soup.  Everything that followed was good, especially the kabob which was flavorful and tender.  There was so much food that by the 6th plate, I was so full that I could barely put a dent in the chicken or dessert.  Thankfully they let you take leftover food home.  

Ambiance - The restaurant itself is very cozy and ethnic looking, at least that's what it's going for.  I've never been to Morocco so I don't know how authentic it all is, but they did a good job in making the customer feel like they've left Vegas and entered a Moroccan lounge. 

Talented belly dancers - they come out once every hour and a half and dance for 10 minutes.  

NEGATIVES: 

Lack of menu options

Shrimp tasted like rubber

Soup tasted like canned soup

CONCLUSION:

If it were my restaurant, I'd replace the shrimp scampi plate with something else, get rid of the soup, and maybe throw some more options in the menu that allow the customer to have more variety.  The current 7 course meal is fine for the first time customer, but I don't see how this business would attract repeat customers using the same foods.

Great Staff, Great Food, and WOW can they dance! I would come back anytime. Before they brought out the main course I was full, left alot of food, since I am in a hotel on the strip, but had a ton we could bring home.

Dining at Marrakech has become a tradition of my friends' annual trip to Vegas and I was delighted to be able to join them this year. The restaurant is located off strip so prepared to take a cab. 

Yes, the dining room is one large room and fairly small compared to other Vegas restaurants, but I liked the ambiance, finding that it lent to the intimacy of the experience. Guests are seated on couches at low tables. Be prepared to eat with your hands (they do provide rose water for cleansing before dining.) 

I enjoyed almost all of the food during the six courses served: warm bread, shrimp, soup, steak kabobs, chicken and rice, and a banana & chocolate souffle-type pastry. While the food wasn't mind-blowing, I did enjoy it. 

Belly dancing is dispersed throughout the evening. The women will encourage others to get up and dance with them. I was too shy, but one of my friends got up and had a great time. 

Overall I'm looking forward to returning again should I make it to Vegas next year.

Great food, but even better people!

We've been here twice with large groups and both times were excellent!!  Tariq ( the owner) was extremely quick and responsive when we were planning the event. He made it easy on us and when our party grew by about 10 people, they were still all smiles and helpful!

The food was amazing both times and I love that they have simple rates for everyone (one price for the meal and then an additional price if they wanted an open bar). This makes it very simple for large groups. We loved all the food, but I'm telling you the service is beyond anything I've experienced with a large group. We loved them!!! 

Do yourself a favor, and book them for your next event! You won't be disappointed!!

Last week I went with some girlfriends to Vegas for my 30th birthday (yay!) and we really wanted to try a unique restaurant...Marrakech fit the bill perfectly and I'm so happy we decided to be adventurous and leave the strip!

The decor is amazing...the second you walk through the door, you feel as though you've been swept out of the country.

The wait staff was attentive and extremely funny...our waiter dances for the ladies ;). The gal who did the belly dancing was entertaining, talented and very sweet. I admit, she got me up to shake my groove thing...though I'm not nearly as good at belly dancing as she was...but watch out...I may be working there soon. Ha!

The food was delicious. It is a 6-course set menu, starting with shrimp scampi that is buttery, garlicky and fantastic. Then the tomato lentil soup...nice and hearty but not too heavy. I liked the vegetables and hummus, but I don't think that was the favorite with the other gals. The beef kabobs were phenomenal. OMG, melt in your mouth good and I loved the presentation! Then the fall off the bone chicken and couscous was fabulous, but at this point we were getting so full that we left so much on the plate! Dessert was good, but not my cup of tea. I felt it was missing something, but not sure what. Oh and the tea they served was delicious...definitely the best part of dessert.

So next time you are in Vegas, be adventurous and go off the beaten path...you won't  be sorry!
This place feels like home to me. My most memorable moments in life have happened here. Birthdays, marriage proposal and wedding party.

Amazing food, great atmosphere, wonderful experience! I highly recommend this place! If your a Las Vegas local or a visitor to town,  come to this place. You won't regret it! Can't wait to come back!!! 5 star all the way!

4 stars for the food and ambience, 3 stars for the service.

We were seated after 15 minutes of just standing there and the waiters ignoring us, when we had a reservation and there were plenty of available seats.

When we were finally seated, we waited another 20 minutes for a waiter to give us some water and bread. We came all the way from OC for this restaurant and you want us to just sit here forever?

The food finally arrives, and man, it was all good. Especially eating with your hands. And eating delicious food with your hands. I most especially love the beef kabobs. They were the most tender pieces of meat I have ever sunk my teeth into. It was like biting into a dream. Lol. I thought they were the main course! But there's more food! We were full by then and had to run to watch a show on the strip so we had to go... Regrettably. If not for the show, we would have stayed to keep watching the lovely and amazing belly dancer, and maybe tried some hookah. Or just lounge there and enjoy the ambiance and the dessert. 

We wish we could've been served better, though. We have a Groupon deal for four but they would only serve us food for two. It's like paying regular price when we could have taken the other food home and wallowed in the dreaminess of the tender beef. It was unfair! Just because our friends couldn't make it. And they made us wait forever. Anyway, I had a lot of fun an it was definitely a good experience. :)

My husband took me here last month as a surprise for my birthday. The most unique experience ever and I was pleasantly surprised! I never had Moroccan food before, so I was a bit nervous. I also never experienced a 6 course meal before. This place blew my mind. The meal is set so there is no guessing over a menu on which items to order.The ambiance is amazing, its romantic, the food was delicious, and the experience is unforgettable. They even have a friendly belly dancer  that entertains you throughout your meal.
Great place to go for special occasions. Pricey, but you get what you pay for!
I really enjoyed the vibe and the belly dancer was awesome. Food was just ok, although the dessert was really good and I loved the babaganoush. Had an enjoyable experience. Service was awesome.
Great food! Great entertainment! Great serve! I am a local and I can't wait to go back!

So much fun!! Marrakech is a perfect place to spend a evening filled with delicious food and dancing. A great escape from the endless buffets and crazy Vegas nightclub scene.

The pre fix menu keeps everything simple and allows you to relax and enjoy the ambiance and belly dancing the minute you are seated. To start with, the staff is very accommodating. We had a few vegetarians in our group and they happily gave us huge portions of both the vegetarian and meat dishes. Everything was delicious! Also they are very good with their timing in bring out the dishes, allowing you to actually enjoy the food, atmosphere and your company without feeling rushed to leave. By the time dessert came around, we were all ridiculously full and had it packed. 

Also the belly dancers were amazing! Loved how they were so inviting and brought up everyone to dance. They deserve 5 stars alone!

All in all, Marrakech definitely needs to a part of your Vegas visit!

Great food, great people and great entertainment. Each course was scrumptious and perfectly seasoned. The owner Tariq was very accommodating and engaging.  The belly dancer was beautiful and so fun. Thanks for making my wife's birthday a memorable experience!

One word - so funandamazing! Ok, I dont think that's really one word, but when you find a great place to eat and be entertained, you make some exceptions.   My military unit was staying nearbye this restaurant and a frequent visitor (new guy in the unit) wouldnt shut up about this place.  After finally being convinced to try the place, I soon found out the reason why he was so enthusiastic.

First of all they have a six course meal and it IS delicious.  From the start all the way til the end the food was delicious.  The very first dish was the shrimp scampi - this dish was the best shrimp scampi dish i've ever  had.  One word of advice, you have to try the bread and dip into the savory shrimp scampi sauce.  The next dish was the lentil soup.  I've only had a few bowls of this stuff, but the way this place makes it, it comes out very lemony and tasty.  The steak skewer was perfectly grilled and the rest of the meal was great. 

To finish it off, the tea that they give you was the perfect way to end it. Who would have ever thought that an extremley hot, sweet tea would be a nice way to end a meal.  Thanks to my friend who was so insistent on going here.  I've now found a place I must head to every time to vegas.  You can have your buffets, but this place rocks and I will now be a frequent customer every time I head to vegas.

ps - the belly dancer is amazing too ; )  best i've ever seen!

My family has been coming to Marrakech in Vegas for as long as I can remember. So, when I saw a groupon for it we snatched that baby up and booked a reservation for July 4th weekend, during our recent trip to Vegas. The coupon helped tremendously, since there were 7 of us and this place is a tad on the expensive side, but for all you get, it is surely worth the price. 

Based on the food alone I would probably rate this restaurant 3 stars, but who goes here JUST for the food - no one. The experience is well worth the price and even though the food isn't the BEST I've ever had, it is pretty good. Stand outs for me are the shrimp appetizer with bread, which is so good. Soaking up that buttery, garlicky sauce with fresh bread is excellent. I love the hummus and pickled carrots. The soup is OK (I would cut this course out if I could). The beef kabobs are the BOMB! They are so well cooked and extra yummy. The chicken is moist, and the cous cous is good, but nothing special. The dessert was different this past time than it previously was. I liked how it used to be - nuts and chicken- this time it was bananas and chocolate and I'm allergic to bananas and I didn't know they were in there, so that was a bummer. 

The belly dancing MAKES this place. It's fun, and I love seeing my Husband get pulled up to dance with the girls. Cracks me up every time. I would say go to Marrakech for the experience at least once when you are in Vegas. It's off the strip, but well worth going... you'll have some funny trying something different and unique!

What a fantastic off the wall spot. A very unique dining experience. Additionally, the customer service was amazing. Hani the manager went above and beyond to accommodate our large group. And was also very sensitive to the food allergies/sensitivities in our group, bringing special desserts and keeping the pita out of the dips for our gluten-free friend. The food was delicious, the belly dancing phenomenal. Highly recommended for a different experience in Vegas!  Thank you Hani!
Love this place from the atmosphere the food the belly dancers everything. Prices are not cheap but that is ok because they keep the place clean and the staff are very friendly

We read about this place in a list for unique dining experiences in Las Vegas and it was really a fun and delicious meal. The menu is price fixe and for $45 you get a 6 course meal that includes amazing bread, beef, and banana chocolate pastry. I would seriously consider fasting all day before this epic meal as we really struggled to eat it all because it's just so much food! Also definitely make a reservation as it's a very intimate space. Expect to spend some money but leave full and with a fun experience.

WHAT A DINNING EXPERIENCE!!

I was greeted by a hostess right outside the door.  As I took a few steps passed the door, I had to step through another doorway with hanging curtains-- then, I was transported to what seems like a magical far-away place (I had never experience anything like this before!!) The decor and setting of the place was outstanding! I felt like I was in an authentic Moroccan tent with draping fabrics on the ceilings; hookahs in the corners; low-leveled seatings and tables; dim lightings with lit candles; beautifully printed fabrics and carpets covered every space of the walls. 

This place has a prixe fixe  6 course menu--  $39.96 per person. My favorite was the Beef Brochette (Kabob). It was super (SUPER) juicy, tender and...definitely grilled to perfection! Be sure to dip them into the  two dips from the sampler's plate. The overall dining experience was  3.5/5. Not every dish was a hit nor was it a miss for me. It was definitely fun trying new things.

The belly dancers were amazing. It was mesmerizing to watch and entertaining at the same time. The music was thumping non-stop!!  

If you're all about experiencing new things and want to be transported out of Las Vegas for a few hours, definitely come check this place out. Be sure to mention that you came across this place on Yelp to get your 15% off from your entire bill. Reservation is required.
You step into a different world once you enter, dark and intimate. Dinner was a prefixe meal with 4-5 courses. Be very hungry when you come.
Amazing!!! There isn't much else I can say.  They accommodated our large party and modify there menu so we could make our show!  Food was out of this world!

Thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised by the decor and ambience. Come hungry, they bring out so much food. It was pretty good but I would have preferred more spice. Was a little more expensive then we were expecting but the not over e top. The Belly dancers were great also, it topped off the ambience.

5 stars for Ambiance and Service!
Overall 3 stars because:
1) Customers cannot order from a menu and are offered only one choice: A Six Course Meal for a fixed price.
2) Though the six course meal clearly mentions Mint Tea which is served along with the dessert, if you want your mint tea earlier with your food they will charge you extra.
3) For 1 person: The six course meal with an added charge for asking for the Mint Tea with my food was $ 54 (tip not included).
4) You cannot eat and leave quickly. The whole thing takes a lot of time and so you should be prepared to spend a lot longer than most places. 

- As you can see this is a more expensive place than the average because you are forced to spend a fixed amount which is much higher than an average entree by itself since you are paying for six courses.

If you wanted to have a meal for less $ than that then this is not a place you want to go to.

If you don't mind the cost, have plenty of time and would like to have a unique experience of being inside a Moroccan tent with soft lighting, music, belly dancing and an authentic feeling ambiance then this is the place for you. Enjoy it!
The six course meal is to die for!  By the time we reached the fourth we were stuffed.  Everything was flavorful and presented beautifully.  The service and belly dancers were spectacular.

This was a different experience. It's a price fixed menu (or at least thats what they sell strongly).  It's a great place to go with a group and enjoy the belly dancer and the unique music and decor. It's an overall very entertaining experience. The food is definitely middle eastern (you eat by hand) but the chicken and the spices were excellent.

Took my husband out for his bday - I've been wanting to try this for a while, but had not had the chance. Went with three other people. Loved it! The only thing I wish is that they didn't rush you with the food - we were only done with one entree before they brought the other ones. 
Otherwise - we were still eating and they would bring out the next entree. Other than that, atmosphere is great, but the belly dancers (who were amazing btw) don't come out every 40 minutes like the waiter told us initially. We got there at 8:00 pm and saw one show, and then at 9:25 the other belly dancer came out... the girls are amazing and it's great to see them dance, but I just wish that they would have let us know that when we came in as opposed to telling us they came out every 40 mins. 

As far as the food goes, it's super delicious. It's a price fixe meal but they're pretty flexible - we were four people and we got 3 price fixe meals. We still had leftovers. 

Overall, great atmosphere, delicious food, and amazing belly dancers! Moroccan wine is great (we ordered two bottles) :) - and we will definitely be back again!

5 stars for the food.

Outstanding Moroccan food. Each dish in our set course for our large group was delicious all the way to the puff pasty dessert.

The belly dancer is entertaining, but she scolded me when I took a picture of her. I guess you are supposed to tip to take a picture. Oh sorry, maybe you should put up a sign. That or maybe just be nice instead.

I bought a deal off Groupon - $30 for $65 worth of food, and used it during the 4th of July weekend with 5 other people. If I had to pay full price, I would not come here.

Food is mediocre. You can say you're "paying for the experience", but the experience was whatevers too. I like the decor, but that was about it. The belly dancer is not that great either.  You can probably find a better Morrocan Restaurant that serves even better food.

I found this restaurant accidentally when I was visiting Vegas. I searched for a Mediterranean place for dinner on yelp and Marrakech came up as one with the highest rates. The dinner style was different than usual, it was full course dinner that consisted of six different dishes: lentil soup, shrimp scampi, sides, kabob platter, couscous platter, B'stilla chocolate. The portions were generous and definitely too much for one person to eat in one setting. I took out the left over in boxes and ate it next day. Surprisingly the food was still fresh and delicious. 

Marrakech is absolutely worth trying.

We just finished our meal at Marrakech for the first time.
